result.execSummary:
The defendant Hakeem Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA by 4/10/2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hakeem Hicks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
PSI reviewed and corrections made.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  98 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 98 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered the defendant pay all all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 04/10/2016. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter.


Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Hakeem Hicks in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Hakeem Hicks in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Hakeem Hicks not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant not produced.  Case heard off the record.  Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing.  Court is in trial and unable to hear case. Case adjourned to Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Hakeem Hicks not in court, in custody.  Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Hakeem Hicks in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Hakeem Hicks in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Hakeem Hicks in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Hakeem Hicks in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Count 2 ( Misdemeanor).  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
